Description: Painted calcite shabti of Tamery with a short blue lappet-wig, green and black eyes, a red mouth, crossed arms traced in black with a lotus held in one hand, the folds of a girdle marked in black, the back (damaged) has a seed-bag traced in black, the back of the legs is inscribed with two columns of black painted Hieroglyphs.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
